item.title: Leaves need sweeping on Derwent Grove. This road on schedule for last week and was missed., 18th November
item.description:
Previously reported 17 Nov and marked as ‘fixed’. Please explain how it’s been fixed? The leaves are still there. Neighbouring roads were swept - not Derwent. Was on schedule for last week. Has this been changed?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Derwent Grove, East Dulwich, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New street light too bright and disturbs sleep located on raglan road, 18th November
item.description:
Couldn't find an appropriate category. However, this relatively new lamp post raised to a taller height and led than the original is now shinging directly into our home. At night with the window blinds shut it is still so bright that it lights the entire room and into landing. We have shutters and blinds and black out blinds are out of the question. Can you please reduce the strength of light from this lamp post. Ideally reduce its height too. Sleep patterns have been completely destroyed since this lamp has been installed. Lamp post located by green media box on raglan road outside 41 southlands road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Raglan Road, Widmore, Bromley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Action Required – Hazardous Waste (Asbestos & Biological Waste) on the Purbrook Estate, 18th November
item.description:
Dear Southwark Council, I am writing to urgently report a serious health and safety hazard on our estate. There is asbestos-containing board debris, blood-stained waste, and bagged dog waste scattered across multiple areas. This has been reported several times previously, but the issue remains unresolved. Children are frequently playing near the contaminated areas, placing them at significant risk. The situation is unsafe, unsanitary, and unacceptable for residents. I request immediate investigation, containment, and removal of all hazardous waste by a qualified team, as well as measures to prevent recurrence. I will be copying this message to my local councillor as well. Please confirm receipt of this notification and advise when action will be taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purbrook Street, Old Kent Road, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box van and two guys dumping here, 18th November
item.description:
It's the same two guys with a box van who's keep dumping stuff up against the flats number one RAVENSBOURNE HOUSE NW8 8BE And this time it is really badly, it stinks really badly, A TOXIC mattress that's looks like someone died in a fire on it; and other dangerous flammable material's that's require urgent removal away from the house. Please guy's, Pleeeeaaase; can you tonight? Many thanks guy's, I appreciate you all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penfold Street, St. John's Wood, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet
